No. 163. September 1928. THIS Report gives a summary of the recently published returns ofunemployment in the various industries. In Table (A) is shown the course ofunemployment during September, while Table (B) gives an analysis of the numberof persons on the registers of Employment Exchanges in Great Britain at the24th September, 1928.(A.) Unemployment in Insured Industries. The latest date for which unemployment figures by industries are available is the 24th September, 1928, at which date the percentage unemployed in GreatBritain and Northern Ireland was 11'5, as compared with 11*7 at the20th August, 1928, with 9'4 at the 26th September, 1927, and with 13'9* at the20th September, 1926. (D.) Latest Figures. The latest figure of unemployment available is that for the 15th October, 1928,giving a total number on the registers for Great Britain of 1,321,200. This is anincrease over the position on the 24th September amounting to 25,966, and anincrease over a year ago of 249,904. ARTHUR STEEL-MAITLAND.Ministry of Labour, October 25, 1928.
